nodes.bodyText: I suggest making valPara a StringBuilder instance instead since you do a lot of concatenation with it.
Would it be possible to make type an enum instead of a string?
I added constants for the different types. I cannot use enum because it cannot be used in switch/case.
But enum can be used in switch/case... it is one of the primary benefits of using an enum.
That is fine for me. An enum type would be better but a constant works as well.
This method should exit early if necessary logging levels are not enabled.

Instead of getting the httpClient reference through the set/unset methods you should instead have the HttpClientFactory passed in through the KM200HandlerFactory constructor; that way you can make the httpClient field non-null and final.

Do you maybe have an example you to do this? I'm not sure about the interface to the constructor of KM200HandlerFactory instead of the reference anotation to set/unset. How can I modify the call to the modified constructor? Usually the system is searching fo a constructor with 0 arguments. Is there a different annotation type for this case? Sorry, I don't know how to do this..
and here, you get the idea. Please update all other methods similarly.

The error logging level should be reserved for issues catastrophic enough to threaten the operation of openHab itself. In error in a binding shouldn't qualify for this. Please read the openHab coding guidelines for expected use of logging in bindings.
Ok, I will take a closer look to it.
Should probably make all these string literals constants
I changed it. It is using now constants from the CoreItemFactory class.
You can get this one in the constructor too

Any time you create your own threadpool in a binding you should make sure that theadpool gives the threads names that identify this binding as the creator. Also make sure that the created threads are daemon.
Using a NamedThreadFactory can accomplish this just make sure to replace ... with the prefix for your thread names.

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    executor = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(2);
          
          
            
                    executor = Executors.newScheduledThreadPool(2, new NamedThreadFactory(...,true));
          
      
    
    
  

That said, I do have to ask why aren't you using the scheduler instead?
I tested both for this binding in the past. The threadpool solution was better for this case. I will add the prefix.
please remove all the blank lines after your break statements.
Why is a static field getting populated by a constructor? Please do this in a static{...} block instead.
Ohh, yes, you're right. I fixed it.
Once you make the KM200ChannelTypeProvider non-null and final in the ThingHandlerFactory then you should be able to make the non-null again.
I rechecked all log entries now.
Why are you sleeping in a synchronized block? Or better question, why do you need to sleep the thread?
The device needs a bit time to recover.
